{{infobox character | people=[[Arnor]]ian | name=Aratan | image=The Lord of the Rings Online - Aratan.jpg | caption=Aratan in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' | pronun=[[Quenya|Q]], {{IPA|[ˈaratan]}} | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Gondor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Sindarin]], [[Westron]] | birth={{SA|3339}}{{PM|Elendil}} | birthlocation=[[Gondor]] | rule= | death={{TA|2}} | deathlocation=[[Disaster of the Gladden Fields]] | age=104 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Isildur]] | parentage=[[Isildur]] | siblings=[[Elendur (son of Isildur)|Elendur]], [[Ciryon]] and [[Valandil (King of Arnor)|Valandil]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Aratan''' was the second son of [[Isildur]]. ==History== In the War of the [[Last Alliance of Elves and Men]], Aratan and his brother [[Ciryon]] did not participate in the [[Siege of Barad-dûr]]. Isildur had sent these two brothers to man [[Minas Ithil]] so as to guard [[Cirith Dúath]] and prevent a possible breakout of [[Sauron]] should he escape the siege.{{UT|7a}}, note 11 In the [[Disaster of the Gladden Fields]], Ciryon was the first brother to fall; Aratan was mortally wounded while trying to save him. After Aratan was wounded, [[Elendur (son of Isildur)|Elendur]] advised his father to put on [[the One Ring]] and escape.{{UT|Gladden}} ==Etymology== ''Aratan'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Stracks suggests it means "Noble Man" and is a compound of ''[[ar|(a)ra-]]'' ("noble") and ''[[atan]]'' ("Man").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2211246019.html|articlename=Q. ''{{TA|185}} - {{TA|435|n}}''}} {{familytree/end}} ==Other versions of the legendarium== In early manuscripts Aratan was named "Eärnur". ==Portrayal in adaptations== '''2019: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':''' :The three elder sons of Isildur appear during an extended flashback set during the [[Siege of Barad-dûr]] in the year [[Second Age 3440|S.A. 3440]]. However, because the game's license does not cover the works in which they are named, they are referred to only by their war-time aliases, meant to hide their kinship with the King.
